msgSnippet: ... I am a newbie too. I suspect your question is too general to answer. Have you done some research? I know there are articles and faq s available on testing,
messageBody:
heriantotan wrote:

>
>Hi,
>
>I'm a newbie to UnitTesting.
>I need your advise on how to develop a unit testing on an
>application.
>
>
>
>These are my application flow:
>- This is a standalone application(no GUI) that connects to a server
>to receive information via callback method.
>- The received information will be processed and sent back to the
>same server as a new information
>- The server validates the information and returns the confirmation
>whether the information is acceptable.
>
>1)I need to test whether the information I receive is valid
>2)I need to test the status sent back by server whenever I send the
>correct or incorrect information to the server.
>
>How am I going to design a testcase?
>
>
I am a newbie too. I suspect your question is too general to answer.
Have you done some research?
I know there are articles and faq's available on testing, so start
there. I am sorry I can't point you to a specific article on testing a
server (maybe someone else can).
If you want to learn how to use junit for testing have a look at
http://www.junit.org/index.htm.
Have a browse around the junit-site, read articles and start testing.

If you really don't know how to go about testing, buy a book.
The TDD-book is good start: "Test Driven Development: A Practical Guide"
by David Astels.
You can find it on amazon. This link leads to information from it's
home-site (source code for instance):
http://www.adaptionsoft.com/tddapg.html

And then, if you have a specific problem while testing, people can (and
probably will) help.

Guus.
